html.label: SInfo
html.b: Thank you for participating in this survey. All information collected in this survey will be kept completely confidential and anonymous.

radio.label: S0
radio.title:
We believe in research
We want to remind you the company sponsoring this relies on the results to make key business decisions. Therefore, it's very important that you provide considered and accurate responses.
You'll notice some simple questions unrelated to the survey topic, they're part of our quality controls, to ensure you're paying attention.
If a participant fails these questions, the survey may be treated as invalid. And you may not get full incentives.
Are you happy to co-operate with these quality controls and to answer this survey accurately?

survey.html:
Thank you for helping with our survey.
We would like to remind you that there are no right or wrong answers - it's your own thoughts and opinions that matter. Any comments you make will not be linked to you personally, but will be reported as a group. Please take your time in completing this questionnaire thoroughly. For most questions, you will only need to click in a tick box with your mouse. Other questions will require you to type in a response or a value.
Now, I would like to ask you about...

block.label: b4
block.builder:title: VideoCapture Element Block
block.html: You may be asked to provide a video answer (for an additional incentive of $5 if applicable) to one or more of the questions in this survey, if possible, please complete it on a device with a webcam or built-in camera. Remember that you do not have to participate immediately – feel free to complete this survey at a better time, or when you're in a better location to record a video.

Video opt-in
We Fiftyfive5 (FIFTY-FIVE FIVE PTY. LTD, ABN 87 142 679 221) are interested in hearing what consumers think about (insert question topic) and would like to ask if you are open to sharing your comments via a video response.
We find that we are able to get richer feedback when participants speak aloud their thoughts, rather than typing them into a text box. The video you record will not be used beyond this study and will be stored anonymously and will not be shared in any public domain.
Communication
Your participation in this video section is voluntary. If you do respond your Video Response must:-
respond fully to the questionnaire
not violate any third party's intellectual property rights
not be unlawful, offensive, threatening, libellous, defamatory, obscene or otherwise objectionable. For example nudity or semi nudity is likely to be considered obscene.
not be recorded in an inappropriate setting such as for example a toilet.
contain at least 15 seconds of recorded speech
ensure your face is clearly visible
ensure there are no audio or visual issues
How will my video be used?
By recording and submitting a Video Response, you are agreeing to it being used for the purposes stated below. Your Video Response, or parts of it, may be used by Clients or Fiftyfive5 and/or its appointed subcontractors for:
market research and consumer insight purposes
monitoring the quality of responses
processing data for the above purposes.
Storage & Retention
Personal Information that Fiftyfive5 may collect from you is routinely de-identified and/or destroyed. However, until that occurs, you have the right to access any information we hold about you. You may also request at any time to have any information we hold about you de-identified or destroyed. Your personal information will be stored on servers located within Australia.
Privacy Policy
Our Privacy Policy is available here and contains further details regarding how you can access or correct any personal information we hold about you, how you can make a privacy related complaint, how that complaint will be dealt with and the extent to which your information may be disclosed to overseas recipients.

radio.label: VidPrivacy

radio.row: I agree to share my video

block.label: block_instant_feedback_
block.builder:title: instant feedback from quota
block.html:
The next four questions are designed to understand how much you understand about superannuation.
To help us get an accurate snapshot please answer each question based on your current understanding, without referring to any external websites or materials. At the end, we'll tell you how many you got right... and how your responses compare to the rest of our customers who have already taken the survey!

radio.label: B1_text
radio.title: text pipe in

radio.label: B2_text
radio.title: text pipe in

radio.label: B3_text
radio.title: text pipe in

radio.label: B4_text
radio.title: text pipe in

radio.label: B1
radio.title: Before tax (concessional) payments that you or your employer might make into your superannuation fund are taxed at...?

radio.label: B2
radio.title: The annual limit for concessionally taxed payments into your superannuation fund is...?

radio.label: B3
radio.title: The three-year limit for after-tax (non-concessional) payments into your superannuation fund is...?

radio.label: B4
radio.title: The current Superannuation Guarantee rate (that is, the rate of contribution your employer is legislated to pay) is...?

block.exec:
#-----calculate percentage------------------------------------------- total01 = getMarker('/Bans/TT') print "total: ", total01 p.btotal = total01 if total01 ge 1: #------------------------------------------------ b1_current = getMarker('/Bans/B1_yesR1') b1_percent = float(b1_current) / total01 * 100 p.b1NO = "{:10.0f}".format(b1_percent)
#------------------------------------------------ b2_current = getMarker('/Bans/B2_yesR1') b2_percent = float(b2_current) / total01 * 100 p.b2NO = "{:10.0f}".format(b2_percent)
#------------------------------------------------ b3_current = getMarker('/Bans/B3_yesR1') b3_percent = float(b3_current) / total01 * 100 p.b3NO = "{:10.0f}".format(b3_percent)
#------------------------------------------------ b4_current = getMarker('/Bans/B4_yesR1') b4_percent = float(b4_current) / total01 * 100 p.b4NO = "{:10.0f}".format(b4_percent) else: b1_current=0 b2_current=0 b3_current=0 b4_current=0 p.b1NO=0 p.b2NO=0 p.b3NO=0 p.b4NO=0
#------------------------------------------------ print " B1: ", b1_current , " B2: ", b2_current , " B3: ", b3_current , " B4: ", b4_current #------------------------------------------------ print "| ", p.b1NO,"| ", p.b2NO,"| ", p.b3NO,"| ", p.b4NO #------------------------------------------------ p.bcorrectCount = 0 ques=[B1_yes, B2_yes, B3_yes, B4_yes] for x in ques: if x.val == 0: p.bcorrectCount = p.bcorrectCount + 1 B_percent.val = p.bcorrectCount #------------------------------------------------ per01 = getMarker('/Bans/B_percentR1') per02 = getMarker('/Bans/B_percentR2') per03 = getMarker('/Bans/B_percentR3') per04 = getMarker('/Bans/B_percentR4') per05 = getMarker('/Bans/B_percentR5') perTotal = (0*per01) + (25*per02) + (50*per03) + (75*per04) + (100*per05) if total01 ge 1: p.bAver = "{:10.0f}".format( float(perTotal) / total01 ) else: p.bAver = 0 print "Survey average: ", p.bAver print "order: ", B_Section.order
arr000=[per01,per02,per03,per04,per05] print "overrall status:", arr000 no_large = 0 p.BoutText = "0 out of 4" for ind, x in enumerate(arr000): if no_large le x: no_large = x p.BoutText = str(ind) + " out of 4" print "out of text: ",p.BoutText
#------------------------------------------------ print p.bArr
